alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 08 at 3:20AM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow and strong winds possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, except 8 inches or more on ridge tops and elevations above passes possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The eastern Magic Valley, Raft River region, lower Snake Plain, Southern Highlands, and Bear River Range, including but not limited to Carey, Shoshone, Burley, Malta, Sweetzer Summit, American Falls, Aberdeen, Blackfoot, Fort Hall, Pocatello, Rockland, Inkom, McCammon, Malad, Lava Hot Springs, Preston, Fish Creek Summit, and Emigration Summit. * WHEN...From early Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility, leading to localized blizzard conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
